conclusion: To determine the pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K, we can use the information provided in the p-T graph.

premise: The equation of the line in the form p = mT + c, where c is the y-intercept.
conclusion: Using the point (200 K, 0.5 x 10^5 Pa), c = 0.

conclusion: The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.25 x 10^5 Pa.
